Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2011 02:48PM OJulie67 wrote: I just got the phone call thatÂ I get my biopsy tomorrow-Wednesday at 1:00. As many good thoughts and prayers as you guys can give would sure be appreciated. I'm very scared and they said I probably wouldn't know results for 3-5 days after that! This is torture, I swear!! I just want to know whats going on! I know you all understand.
Posts.Title: Cluster calcifications found on mammogram OJulie67 gill27

Posts.Content: OJulie67 wrote: Hi everyone~ I am a 43 year old married mother of 2 girls. I went in Monday for my annual mammogram and yesterday the radiologist called me and asked me to come in for a "re-check" on my left breast. She couldnt give me specifics, so I called my doctor who told me that the report read that they saw a "cluster of calcifications" on my film. I went in yesterday afternoon and had the magnified images taken on the left breast. They never requested a sonogram or anything else. The tech was not very helpful saying, "you know I can't tell you anything, right?" (nice) ughhh...but, she did show me the circled area of concern on the mammogram from Monday. It honestly didn't look any different than the rest of the breast area to me and the circled area was about the size of a quarter. Understandably, I am FREAKING out. I just lost a dear friend in December to breast cancer and I never dreamed I might be headed down the same path. I never knew to ask about BIRADS (until coming to this site today) so I have no idea where I am at. I don't even know that I am asking a specific question in posting here...I am just so scared of the unknown. I am going on Tuesday to my regular doctor for a check up. I was in there 3 weeks ago because I had a "swollen lymph node in the back my neck" (doctor diagnosed it as that) I had a bad upper respiratory infection for almost a month and when I found the lump I went to have it checked...now I get this bad report back from the mammogram and its the same side as the lump in my neck, which is getting smaller now. But, I'm still really scared. Any info or positive thoughts are appreciated. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Cluster calcifications found on mammogram OJulie67 gill27

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2011 04:23PM OJulie67 wrote: Thanks everyone...for the nice comments and information. I honestly think they should have to tell you right away when its something like this...the waiting is just brutal. I'm trying to stay busy on this beautiful day and stay positive but it's so hard not to let your mind drift to places you shouldn't. Thanks again. I really appreciate all the info.

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2011 04:21PM - edited Mar 21, 2011 05:05PM by OJulie67 I was told earlier today I would not get results today but the phone call just came and its B9!!!!!!!!!! Oh thank you Lord and thank you ladies so much for listening to me, calming my fears and being so kind!! You have all been wonderful! The results showed no sign of malignancy and only fibrocystic changes due to hormonal fluctuations most likely. Will do another mammogram in 6 months to watch the area. Thank you again so much. You are all wonderful. I will continue to check in and hoping to hearing good results for everyone else as well.
Posts.Title: Cluster calcifications found on mammogram OJulie67 gill27

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2011 05:44PM OJulie67 wrote: Well, my doctors office was amazing and made some calls to the medical group and got my approval today. I was so relieved. I call the biopsy place and "Erma" (aka Ms. crankypants) tells me, "the girl that schedules the biopsies went home sick today, I'll have her call you in the morning." Disappointed, I ask, "well, what if she is sick tomorrow? Can someone else make the appt. for me?" She says, "We'll see what tomorrow brings." WTF? Really Erma? You can't multi task and make an appt? Oy vei! I'm gonna have a nervous breakdown before I get my butt in there for this procedure!!
Posts.Title: Cluster calcifications found on mammogram OJulie67 gill27

Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2011 07:11PM - edited Mar 8, 2011 08:09PM by OJulie67 I went and saw my doctor today and he said that the new report reads "undeterminate microcalicfication cluster." BI-RAD 4. Biopsy recommended. I do not know the size of the area. He was reading off a faxed over handwritten report from the radiologist...it had not even been dictaphoned yet. I am sooo incredibly scared. My BP was incredibly high and I already take medication for "genetic high BP" So he gave me atavan...but I don't take pills like that and don't plan on taking it now. Maybe yoga or something might be better for me. You guys, I am soooo scared. I have two beautiful little girls ages 12 and 7 and a very loving husband who is as devastated as I am and we don't even know anything yet, really! What am I gonna do? I am now waiting on a referral...Gotta love HMO's. They put in an "urgent request" for it to speed it along and said I should probably hear from the place in a couple days but that they only do biopsies on Wednesday, so I will probably have to wait another week. I cannot imagine feeling like this for another week. I have already lost 5 lbs in a week and I don't have much meat on me now. My labs they did all came back perfectly normal and "excellent" in his words and he said if this does turn out to be anything I am in perfect condition to fight it. :( I should also add that I have implants (saline under the muscle) so I am concerned about how a needle biopsy is done with implants. It is my understanding this is the way they want to go. I have an HMO, so I don't even know what kind of person i am going to "get" to do this.
Posts.Title: Cluster calcifications found on mammogram OJulie67 gill27

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2011 11:51AM OJulie67 wrote: Believe it or not-I still don't have an appointment for a biopsy. It has been a circus of losing films between offices, confusion, and just plain- people not doing their job. I am sitting here today hoping that I get the call that everything is set, the radiologist has "approved" my films that were delivered by courier this morning. That way they can schedule the biopsy for tomorrow. Otherwise I have to wait until April 13th when they have their next available appt. opening. This has certainly been the biggest nightmare of my life and its crazy to me that other people seem to be in control of my life at this time. I truly don't know how I can continue waiting day after day like this.
Posts.Title: Cluster calcifications found on mammogram OJulie67 gill27

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2011 05:04PM OJulie67 wrote: OH! Wonderfullymade~I am so sorry to hear you're going through so much right now. You will be in my thoughts and prayers. I am so blessed to have found this board. Although my husband and friends have beenso incredibly sweet through this whole thing, its so nice to have people who know what I'm going through. Thank you all so much!! I will update as soon as I know my results.
Posts.Title: Cluster calcifications found on mammogram OJulie67 gill27

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2011 11:13AM OJulie67 wrote: I had my biopsy yesterday. It wasn't that bad at all. No complications, I'm not even that sore and now I am just waiting for the results. I saw the films and they were so tiny. maybe just about 5 calcs no bigger than the tip of a pin/needle. They were all together in one little area.She said the Calcs all came out with the sterotactic biopsy, along with some tissue samples. They took more mammogram pictures after and they were gone and the little "chip" they placed was there instead. This is all so surreal. I'm still super scared, but trying to be hopeful. They told me the 80% benign statistics and gave me a hug and sent me on my way. I sure hope I fall on those side of the odds. How long did it take for you guys to get results? They told me possibly Monday I might know something. I was hoping it might be earlier. The thought of having this twisted stomach another weekend is killing me.
Posts.Title: Cluster calcifications found on mammogram OJulie67 gill27

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2011 09:07PM OJulie67 wrote: Yes, Cari! The BEST word for sure!! It's actually sinking in now. Thank you all again...so much.

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2011 11:24AM OJulie67 wrote: I appreciate your kind words and positive stories. I need that. I am just a mess. My stomach is twisted in knots. I cannot sleep. I wake up hearingÂ words like, "microcalcifications, indeterminate," etc in my head. I cannot eat, I know I should, but nothing looksÂ  or sounds good. I want my girls to not suspect anything is going on, so they are the only things that are keeping me somewhat put together. I just can't believe I have to wait to even MAKE an appt. We had such good insurance 3 years ago and I could go anywhere and see any doctor. Than my husband, who is a sheriffs deputy, changed depts. and we had to go with an HMO because our local dept. Didn't offer as good insurance as the state agency he was working for before. So I wait...and then I wait some more. Someone could get VERY sick just waiting. I know you guys all understand and have been here...I just have never had any health issues before...other than my BP and I just don't even know how to handle this level of stress. Thanks again for listening.
